https://prez.dev/description.@value: The primary purpose for which a borehole was drilled or any secondary purpose that the borehole may acquire during its lifecycle. The vocabulary focuses on drilling purposes within the resources industry, with a focus on terminology as applied in the Geological Survey of Western Australia (GSWA) databases. Some terms covered by jurisdictional legislation are highlighted in the provenance field. Variations in terminology within definitions (i.e. usage of borehole, well and wellbore) stem from usage in different sectors of the resources industry, but for the purpose of this vocabulary are considered to be equivalent. In the context of this vocabulary, the term fluid energy refers to sources such as gas, petroleum and geothermal, as covered by the Petroleum Legislation Amendment Act 2024, and is exclusive of mineral sources of energy (e.g. coal, uranium).

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Drilling for the primary purpose of understanding the geological characteristics of the site, such as stratigraphy, structure, and physical or chemical rock properties. These boreholes are generally drilled as part of scientific/technical investigations conducted by government or research organizations.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Definition compiled by the Geological Survey of Western Australia.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: Drilling for the primary purpose of understanding the geological characteristics of the site, such as stratigraphy, structure, and physical or chemical rock properties. These boreholes are generally drilled as part of scientific/technical investigations conducted by government or research organizations.

A borehole/well drilled variously to: provide geological information in areas of poor outcrop and inadequate drillhole coverage, such as assisting the determination of the lithological intervals and stratigraphy present at a location (e.g. GSQ stratigraphic drilling); permit the collection of pristine samples for biostratigraphic, geochemical, geochronological or other studies; investigate the presence of geological setting(s) favourable for mineralization; and/or evaluate emerging technologies. The concept is similar to 'stratigraphic/structural/research (mineral exploration)', but is distinct in not having a primary economic focus.

A borehole drilled to determine the lithological and stratigraphic intervals present at a location and/or to evaluate emerging technologies. Typically to enhance geological understanding of an area and/or to investigate the presence of geological setting(s) favourable for mineralization. It is most commonly associated with government drilling programs.

A borehole/well drilled to investigate the attitude of strata and structural/tectonic relationships of rock units at a location. Typically to enhance geological understanding of an area and/or to investigate the presence of geological setting(s) favourable for mineralization. Most commonly associated with government drilling programs or early stages of exploration. The concept is similar to 'stratigraphic/structural/research (mineral exploration)', but is distinct in not having a primary economic focus.
